text:
If there are errors in /WEB-INF/web.xml (if the XML is either not well-formed 
or invalid), the context is deployed anyway, but using the defaults. This can 
lead to some security problems (if a security constraint was supposedly defined 
in the invalid web.xml).

Of course, there are plenty of warnings displayed and logged if the web.xml is 
invalid, so the user is properly warned.

Is this the expected behavior, or is this a bug ?
